Title: Senior Analyst, Business Planning Analytics
RoleDescription:
At this time, Wayfair does not provide sponsorship for employment authorization for this position.
Wayfair is seeking a relentlessly curious, solutions-oriented Manager to join the Global Planning & Analytics team. This team provides thought leadership and analytical rigor needed to drive our rapidly evolving Wayfair Professional & Global sales teams.
The Global Planning & Analytics team is responsible for analyzing customer behavior, sales and operational performance to provide visibility, test and optimize strategic business initiatives. The team is highly cross-functional and works closely with Product Management, Engineering, Data Science, Field operation, Marketing and Storefront to grow the Wayfair Professional & Global sales teams.
What Youll Do:
In this role, you will be a key contributor and assist with business insights for the Wayfair Professional & Global sales teams. This role requires a blend of strong analytical experience, stakeholder management, business acumen and strong communication. All these skill sets will be applied in tandem with understanding customer behavior and business performance to drive revenue growth, better customer experience, operational efficiency and profitability. You will think critically to tackle complex challenges in a fast-paced and high-growth environment.
In this role, you can expect to:

 Solve difficult, non-routine analysis problems with deep customer focus, applying advanced analytical methods and recommending innovative approaches as needed
Build a strong understanding of Wayfair professional & B2C sales operations along with KPIs that impact overall business performance such as efficiency, conversion rates etc.
Support weekly/monthly performance reviews by analyzing past performance with leadership and recommend go forward initiatives to drive long term profitability and alignment with OKRs.
Work with several large and complex databases using Google Big query including sales, product, and customer data to synthesize insights used for decision-making; providing actionable takeaways and point of view when presenting business cases to senior leadership 
Collaborate with Data Science, Infrastructure, and other Analytics teams using tools such as SQL, Excel, Looker, and Google data studio to deliver real-time performance data to the business leadership team, formulate hypotheses, develop models and socialize recommendations that address strategic and operational challenges 
Take initiative to dive deeper and understand the logic behind data science models that influence customer targeting, call routing, customer valuation etc.

What Youll Need:

Bachelors degree in a quantitative field; Masters in Business, Economics, Finance, Mathematics, or Analytics preferred, but not required
Post-graduate work in related field, preferred
Prior management consulting experience or internship, a plus
Strong analytical background and 2+ years of experience in extracting insights and operating with large data sets to identify trends and actionable takeaways
Expertise in SQL and Excel required
Proficiency in data analysis and visualization tools such as SAS, Tableau, Microstrategy, Google Data Studio, and Looker
Excellent communication skills; demonstrated experience collaborating with cross-functional teams
Entrepreneurial spirit or prior experience in a high performance, fast-paced environment
Highly motivated, with the ability to work effectively both independently and as part of a team

Title: Sales Specialist
RoleDescription:
Sales Specialist 
Come join the team that is reinventing home! Wayfair is hiring for our Birch Lane retail store! If you are looking for rapid growth, constant learning and dynamic challenges, this store  might be the future home for your career.
 
What youll do:

Provide an authentic, friendly customer experience that exemplifies our Wayfair commitment to relentless customer focus.
Provide coaching and support to the Sales Associate team and support their allocated workload efforts as determined by the Store Leader. Depending on the specific work shift, this associate will help open and/or close the store, with keyholder responsibilities. 
Support associates to help drive exceptional customer service and maintain a strong visible presence in the designated work area to drive sales and strong customer service.
Support Store Leaders to train and develop associates on knowledge of our product, selling,  customer service, operations, visual, and other aspects of their roles. .
Along with the Store Manager, provide helpful observation feedback and thoughtful guidance to Sales Associates to aid them to  adapt and grow. 
Focus on delivering and driving individual and team sales and service KPIs, productivity standards and store goals. 
Lead the use of utilization design tools, CRM software and client accounts for consistent customer experience and record keeping.  
Master selling essentials, sales analytics tools, and other training resources to educate the team on our wide array of product assortment. 
Manage and monitor stock levels, merchandise adjacencies,  presentations, signing, and assortment in all departments to ensure the sales-floor is adequately stocked. Maintain visual standards of the store, per home office directive.
Work with a team to ensure the store meets visual, replenishment, cleanliness, safety and back of house standards during floor leadership shifts.
Engage in a high energy and dynamic work environment where there can be rapid changes in products, promotions, offerings and operations.

 
What youll need:

2+ years experience motivating a team to achieve sales goals (preferably as a store Leader or Trainer)
Passion for great customer service and a drive to exceed sales targets. 


Strong organization, self-motivation, communication and relationship management skills
An ability to handle customer escalations and demonstrate professional maturity
Ability to learn and adapt to a vast product catalog 


Track record of thriving in a fast paced and changing environment.
Demonstrated ability to work within a team sales environment.
Technical acumen to learn necessary software; proficiency in Google Suites and/or Microsoft Office applications preferred.
Track record of thriving in a fast paced and changing environment, with an ability to adapt and grow 
Ability to work a flexible schedule, including nights, weekends, and holidays

 
Physical Requirements:

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently required to stand, walk, talk and hear. The employee frequently is required to handle, or feel and reach with hands and arms. The employee is occasionally required to sit; regularly climb or balance; and frequently stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl. The employee must regularly, frequently or occasionally lift and/or move up to 50 lbs
Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus.

Compensation starting at $20.55 per hour, which increases based on your relevant experience + substantial quarterly bonuses
Medical benefits, financial benefits, and a generous employee discount

Title: Office Manager
RoleDescription:
Location: London
The Wayfair Community Experience team operates physical environments that attract top talent, foster collaboration, nurture employee success and promote retention. Our vision is to provide effective, practical, and productive workplace environments that reflect Wayfairs personality and provide a home for employees to thrive. Our teams are known to be fun, resourceful, solution-oriented, proactive, and thoughtful. 
Supporting 120+ Wayfair employees, as an Office Manager at our London office, you will be responsible for creating a safe, welcoming and efficient environment for our employees whilst promoting our positive Wayfair culture in everything you do. Your role will be employee facing and you will also work with a variety of vendors and visitors, you will place a key emphasis on providing a positive experience for all.  
Key Responsibilities: 

Operate our front desk, providing an exceptional experience for our guests, employees & vendors. 
Manage our office operations in London, including running the snack program, health & safety, maintenance and our mailroom. 
Establish and maintain relationships with outside vendors and our Landlord as necessary for site maintenance; administer local contracts and maintenance agreements. 
Proactively identify ways in which to improve our office environment and make the experience as good as possible.  
Be responsible for our Keycard Management & Inventory system for visitors, new hires and existing employees. 
Take ownership of our Community Experience ticketing system in London; ensuring efficient handling of tickets.
Support with finance and invoice processing, including vendor management and collaboration with our finance teams to ensure speedy payment of our vendors. 
Prepare monthly newsletters and support with business reporting for the London office.
Drive our Wayfair culture through supporting organizing regular employee engagement activations, as well as annual business events.

What you will need

Proven experience operating within an office management or administrative support function ideally within a fast paced environment. 
The aptitude in Google or Microsoft Suite whilst displaying the agility to learn and adapt to new technologies and systems. 
Effective communication skills (written, verbal and in person), with a positive approach to managing internal and external stakeholders.
Demonstrate an organized and structured approach; someone who can drive forward momentum of projects to be delivered on time and within budget. 
Excellent problem-solving skills, with a detail-oriented work approach, to quickly address and adapt to challenges.

Title: Luxury Brand Marketing Manager, Perigold
RoleDescription:
Perigold is seeking a Brand Marketing Manager to join the Perigold Marketing team. In this role, youll be responsible for ensuring brand integrity and consistency across the entire consumer journey to drive consideration, recall, and awareness. Youll develop a deep understanding of the Perigold customer (B2C and B2B), the competitive landscape, and the core brand offering to inform creative briefs, marketing plans and drive best-in-class execution. Youll oversee how the Perigold brand comes to life across key initiatives, including loyalty programs, B2B, and prospecting across the Wayfair family of brands.
This role is based in Boston (4 days in office) and reports to Perigolds Chief Marketing Officer,  with significant cross-functional exposure across our Marketing, Retail, Content, Creative, and Category Management teams.
What Youll Do

Own the brand strategy with the CMO and manage its execution and consistency across customer touch points, inclusive of both B2C and B2B and across the Wayfair Family of Brands
Develop, test, and measure Perigolds B2B marketing strategy, in partnership with the B2B CMO and Marketing teams
Own Perigolds loyalty strategy, inclusive of launch strategy, execution, and ongoing management and measurement
Centralize and evangelize consumer insights, including management of annual Brand Health survey through our external insights vendor
Ensure Brand Communications Calendar reflects a cohesive cross-channel strategy, inclusive of brand and merchandising priorities; work with cross-channel partners to bring to life through GTM process
Partner with Performance Marketing lead and Integrated Marketing Analyst to concept, execute, and measure integrated Brand Campaigns
Partner with marketing channels and Creative teams to ensure brand positioning is effectively integrated into all creative assets
Manages a team of 3 direct reports, including oversight of Promotions & Offers, Supplier Marketing & Advertising, and Curation
Oversee our Supplier Marketing and Advertising function, ensuring our strategy to market our supplier brands ladders up to overall Brand Strategy and maximizes monetization potential 
Oversee our Promotions function, including promotional calendar and campaign execution and measurement
Oversee Curation, ensuring our product curations in marketing and onsite events reflect our SOV priorities and storytelling goals

What Youll Need

5+ years of experience working in brand marketing in a consumer brand, agency, and/or consulting capacity 
Luxury retail experience highly preferred 
A deep understanding of and curiosity about consumer behavior
Demonstrated balance of being highly analytical and originally creative
Critical thinking including the ability to break down complex ideas and generate insights and solutions or strategically build a story from large data sets
Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to influence senior-level and cross-functional stakeholders 
Ability to communicate a high-level brand vision as well as give tactical creative feedback
Strong verbal and written skills including distilling data into compelling, insight-led presentations
Superb project management skills including the ability to work on multiple projects at once
An ownership mindset with the ability to streamline processes and thrive in a highly ambiguous and fast-paced environment with a get stuff done attitude
Collaborative team player who wants to see the whole team succeed and thrive
Familiarity with the latest market trends and best practices especially as it relates to the target consumer

Title: Corporate Travel and Expense Associate
RoleDescription:
This position will be based in our Boston, MA office. All Boston based corporate employees work in the office in a hybrid capacity. Employees will work in the office at 4 days per week and have the option to work remotely 1 day per week.
Wayfair, the largest online-only retailer of home furnishings and housewares in the United States, has an immediate need for a T&E Associate to support the day-to-day travel and expense program. At Wayfair, we move extremely fast with a laser focus on customer success. That means we need people who focus on more than just cost. We need adaptable doers who are great at engaging with stakeholders, creative out of box thinkers, , flexible and fast multi-taskers,.  The ideal candidate will bring strong organizational and planning skills, detail orientation, a high sense of urgency, a sense of humor, and problem-solving abilities to the role. This person should be smart, engaging, fun, curious, and unflappable. 
The global travel and expense associate will be responsible for end-to-end support of the global travel and expense program. This program includes, but is not limited to, travel management companies, airlines, hotels, car rentals, ground transportation and T&E booking/expense software. Provide continuing evaluation and development of technology and systems in the area of travel plus expense reimbursement.

Manage reporting with data inclusive of spend, travel metrics for in-policy/out-of-policy compliance, plus volume trends along with exception reporting, budgeting and forecasting

2+ years of travel management and expense experience
Experience with travel systems (OBTs & Expense software, T&E corporate card)

Experience communicating complex and actionable concepts at a senior executive level

Title: Sr. Benefits Associate
RoleDescription:
This position is a hybrid in-office role that works out of our Boston HQ. Monday-Thursday will be working in office and Friday is WFH. This is not a virtual / remote position.
We are seeking a Senior Benefits Associate to support the administration, compliance, and cost management of our North American health and welfare programs. This role will play a critical part in ensuring compliance with federal, state, and provincial regulations, analyzing key cost drivers, and implementing strategic interventions to optimize healthcare spend.
The ideal candidate is an analytical, detail-oriented professional with a strong understanding of health plan design, regulatory compliance, and benefits analytics. This position offers an opportunity to take ownership of complex projects, collaborate with senior stakeholders, and drive cost-effective, consumer driven benefits strategies.
What You'll Do:
Health Plan Administration & Operations

Support the administration of U.S. and Canadian health & welfare plans, ensuring compliance, efficiency, and a seamless employee experience.
Act as a subject matter expert for escalated benefits issues, partnering with vendors and internal teams to drive resolution.
Lead annual benefits enrollment efforts, including communication strategies, vendor system testing, and employee education initiatives.
Conduct in-depth analyses of claims data, plan performance, and utilization trends to guide program enhancements.

Health Plan Analytics & Cost Containment

Analyze health plan cost drivers, including claims trends, high-cost claimants, and utilization patterns.
Develop and present data-driven recommendations to optimize plan design, reduce unnecessary costs, and enhance employee engagement.
Support negotiations with vendors and insurers to ensure cost-effective benefits solutions.
Stay informed on industry benchmarks, regulatory changes, and emerging trends to proactively manage risks and opportunities.

Compliance & Regulatory Oversight

Ensure ongoing compliance with ERISA, ACA, HIPAA, COBRA, and state-specific regulations.
Lead efforts on 5500 filings, PCORI, RxDC and other mandated reporting 
Partner with legal and external counsel to stay ahead of regulatory updates affecting U.S. and Canadian benefits programs.

Vendor & Stakeholder Collaboration

Manage vendor relationships, ensuring adherence to contracted service levels, reporting accuracy, and cost containment goals.
Support RFPs, plan renewals, and implementation of new benefits programs
Collaborate cross-functionally with Talent, Finance, Legal, and Procurement teams to align benefits programs with business needs.
Provide strategic insights and recommendations to senior leadership on benefits trends and plan performance.

What You'll Need:

3+ years of experience in benefits administration, compliance, or benefits analytics.
Bachelors degree in Human Resources Management or related field preferred - equivalent experience and proven results in HR Management, Benefits, FMLA, ADA will also be strongly considered.
Strong knowledge of U.S. and/or Canadian benefits regulations (ACA, ERISA, HIPAA, COBRA, provincial healthcare laws, etc.).
Experience with health plan data analysis, claims reporting, and cost containment strategies.
Strong problem-solving skills with the ability to interpret complex data and make strategic recommendations.
Ability to work independently in a fast-paced team environment while managing multiple priorities.
Experience working with HRIS systems and benefits platforms (Workday / Alight preferred).
Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills.

Who we are 
Wayfair runs the largest custom e-commerce large parcel network in the United States, approximately 1.6 million square meters of logistics space. The nature of the network is inherently a highly variable ecosystem that requires flexible, reliable, and resilient systems to operate efficiently. 
We are looking for a passionate Backend Software Engineer to join the Fulfillment Optimization team. This team builds the platforms that determine how customer orders are fulfilled, optimizing for Wayfair profitability and customer delight. A big part of our work revolves around enhancing and scaling customer-facing platforms that provide fulfillment information on our websites, starting at the top of the customer funnel on the search pages all the way through orders being delivered. Throughout this customer journey, we are responsible for maintaining an accurate representation of our dynamic supply chain, determining how different products will fit into boxes, predicting how these boxes will flow through warehouses and trucks, and ultimately surfacing the information our customers need to inform their decision and the details our suppliers and carriers require to successfully execute on the promises made to our customers. We do all of this in milliseconds, thousands of times per second.
The Growth & Ad Platforms Engineering team is responsible for building Wayfair's class leading, data centric technology platform that optimizes and powers all of Wayfair's paid advertising. It touches hundreds of millions of consumers and drives billions of dollars in annual revenue. Our platforms allow us to scale our marketing efforts efficiently by automating key processes, interacting with ad vendors in real time and leveraging hundreds of terabytes of data and ML algorithms for optimization and effective decision making on millions of items in our catalog.The types of systems built by this team range from low latency REST APIs, to real time streaming systems to high performance large scale batch systems.

Work with a broader highly collaborative cross-functional team that includes product managers, data scientists, and analysts.
Work with a variety of technologies, including Java, Spark, Kafka, Aerospike, Hadoop, Airflow, RESTful web services, gRPC, Kubernetes. Additionally, youll work with various managed GCP offerings like BigQuery, Composer and Vertex AI.
Build platforms and services that allow us to make realtime ML powered decisions that improve the customers onsite search experience.
Deliver direct measurable results for our business and customers through improved product recommendations.
Mentor junior engineers to develop the next generation of Wayfair engineering.
Provide high quality code and technical design reviews.
Contribute to the code base, with a mind to best practices and an equally high degree of autonomy.









What you will need

A Bachelors Degree in Computer Science, Data Science, or a related engineering discipline.
3+ years of experience in a modern programming language, preferably Java 
Knowledge of scalable distributed systems with deep understanding of object oriented design and design patterns.
Knowledge of designing APIs and microservices.
Experience working on cloud technologies specifically GCP is a plus.

Knowledge of recommendation systems and productionalizing ML models is a plus.

Excellent communication skills and ability to work effectively with engineers, product managers, data scientists, analysts and business stakeholders.

Title: ML Scientist II, Advertising Optimization & Automation Science
RoleDescription:
Candidates for this position are preferred to be based in Bangalore, India and will be expected to comply with their team's hybrid work schedule requirements.
Who We AreWayfairs Advertising business is rapidly expanding, adding hundreds of millions of dollars in profits to Wayfair. We are building Sponsored Products, Display & Video Ad offerings that cater to a variety of Advertiser goals while showing highly relevant and engaging Ads to millions of customers. We are evolving our Ads Platform to empower advertisers across all sophistication levels to grow their business on Wayfair at a strong, positive ROI and are leveraging state of the art Machine Learning techniques. 
The Advertising Optimization & Automation Science team is central to this effort. We leverage machine learning and generative AI to streamline campaign workflows, delivering impactful recommendations on budget allocation, target Return on Ad Spend (tROAS), and SKU selection. Additionally, we are developing intelligent systems for creative optimization and exploring agentic frameworks to further simplify and enhance advertiser interactions.
We are looking for an experienced Machine Learning Scientist II to join the Advertising Optimization & Automation Science team. In this role, you will be responsible for the development of budget, tROAS and SKU recommendations and other machine learning capabilities supporting our ads business. You will work closely with other scientists, as well as members of our internal Product and Engineering teams, to apply your engineering and machine learning skills to solve some of our most impactful and intellectually challenging problems to directly impact Wayfairs revenue.
What youll do

Provide technical leadership in the development of an automated and intelligent advertising system by advancing the state-of-the-art in machine learning techniques to support recommendations for Ads campaigns and other optimizations.
Design, build, deploy and refine extensible, reusable, large-scale, and real-world platforms that optimize our ads experience.
Work cross-functionally with commercial stakeholders to understand business problems or opportunities and develop appropriately scoped machine learning solutions
Collaborate closely with various engineering, infrastructure, and machine learning platform teams to ensure adoption of best-practices in how we build and deploy scalable machine learning services
Identify new opportunities and insights from the data (where can the models be improved? What is the projected ROI of a proposed modification?)
Research new developments in advertising, sort and recommendations research and open-source packages, and incorporate them into our internal packages and systems.
Be obsessed with the customer and maintain a customer-centric lens in how we frame, approach, and ultimately solve every problem we work on.

We Are a Match Because You Have:

Bachelor's or Masters degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or related field.
6-9 years of industry experience in advanced machine learning and statistical modeling, including hands-on designing and building production models at scale.
Strong theoretical understanding of statistical models such as regression, clustering and machine learning algorithms such as decision trees, neural networks, etc. 
Familiarity with machine learning model development frameworks, machine learning orchestration and pipelines with experience in either Airflow, Kubeflow or MLFlow as well as Spark, Kubernetes, Docker, Python, and SQL.
Proficiency in Python or one other high-level programming language 
Solid hands-on expertise deploying machine learning solutions into production
Strong written and verbal communication skills, ability to synthesize conclusions for non-experts, and overall bias towards simplicity 

Nice to have

Familiarity with Machine Learning platforms offered by Google Cloud and how to implement them on a large scale (e.g. BigQuery, GCS, Dataproc, AI Notebooks).
Experience in computational advertising, bidding algorithms, or search ranking
Experience with deep learning frameworks like PyTorch, Tensorflow, etc.

Title: Interior Designer, Retail Specialist
RoleDescription:
Location: 3232 Lake Ave Suite 1, Wilmette, IL 60091
Role Overview:
At Wayfair, we believe everyone deserves a home they loveand as a Design Specialist, youll help make that happen. You'll be more than a salesperson; youll be a trusted design partner, guiding customers through everything from furniture selections to full-room transformations. Using your interior design expertise, trend awareness, and flair for customer service, youll help bring their vision to lifewhether in-store, virtually, or in their home.
This role blends creativity and strategy, giving you the tools to inspire and the autonomy to deliver results. From room layouts to fabric swatches, your design solutions will reflect each customers unique style, budget, and needs. Were not just a storewere a community of creators, doers, and dreamers. At Wayfair, youll join a team that cheers each other on, celebrates wins big and small, and knows that building beautiful homes should also be fun.
Ready to help customers fall in love with their homesand your career? Lets make it happen.
What Does A Retail Design Specialist Do?

 Be the Customers Trusted Advisor: Greet, listen, and learn. Youll lead design consultations that feel more like conversations, getting to know your customers style, needs, and how they really live. Whether its a growing family, a new pet, or a dream remodel, youll help it all come together beautifully.
 Turn Vision Into Reality: Create stunning, functional spaces using your design expertisethink color theory, spatial planning , textiles, and trend-savvy picks. You'll walk customers through fabric swatches, finishes, and product choices with confidence and clarity.
 Inspire with Tech + Tools: Build out 2D/3D room views, mood boards, and persuasive presentations using our design software. (Bonus points if youve dabbled in tools like SketchUp, Revit, or AutoCAD.)

Occasional: Sitting, climbing, balancing, and crawling

Title: B2B Sales Account Manager
RoleDescription:
Overview:
About Wayfair Professional
Wayfair Professional is a leading B2B sales organization focused on helping businesses create exceptional, functional spaces. Since 2012, we've streamlined the procurement process for furniture, fixtures, and dcordelivering fast, reliable, and value-driven solutions tailored to the needs of commercial customers.
We seek a results-driven Business Account Manager (BAM) to manage and grow a portfolio of B2B clients within a dedicated industry vertical. While Wayfair Professional supports a broad range of sectorsincluding Office, Property Management, Construction, Interior Design, and Accommodationsthis role is designed to build deep expertise and long-term relationships within one specific industry.
As a full-cycle sales role, the BAM drives revenue through proactive outreach, strategic relationship management, and consultative selling. Success in this role depends on strong cross-functional collaboration and the ability to deliver tailored solutions that address the unique challenges and opportunities within the assigned industry.

What youll do:

Own and manage a book of high-value accounts, balancing growth, retention, and reactivation. Many accounts are large or complex, requiring strategic sales approaches and seamless cross-functional collaboration.
Consistently drive revenue growth across your portfolio by meeting and exceeding quarterly and annual targets.
Execute proactive, high-quality customer outreachthrough outbound/inbound calls, emails, virtual meetings, and pipeline managementto deepen account engagement and expand share of wallet.
Effectively communicate Wayfairs full value proposition, including product assortment, design services, project management, and tailored solutionsleveraging cross-sell and up-sell opportunities aligned to customer needs.
Partner closely with internal teams (e.g., Service, Design, and Large Project Solutions) to deliver seamless support and ensure a cohesive customer experience.
Foster a continuous feedback loop with customers and internal stakeholders to strengthen relationships, address challenges, and enhance overall account performance.
Leverage sales tools such as Salesforce, Looker, and LinkedIn Sales Navigator to track activity, forecast revenue, and inform strategy. Use performance insights to prioritize initiatives and improve KPIs.
Build long-term client relationships through strategic, consultative sellingcultivating repeat business and maintaining a healthy pipeline of opportunities.
Manage your time effectively to schedule appointments, respond promptly to customer inquiries, and support purchases through the Wayfair Professional platform.
Serve as a subject matter expert on Wayfair Professionals offerings and capabilities, using your industry knowledge to advise customers and deliver value-added solutions.
Collaborate effectively with colleagues and partner teams to drive outcomes, resolve issues, and contribute to a high-performance team culture.
Take a solution-oriented approach to problem-solving, ensuring client satisfaction in every interaction.
Represent the Wayfair brand with professionalism and integrity, consistently embodying our People Principles to deliver a first-class customer experience.

What youll need

Location: This is a remote work position conducted virtually. Travel: 10% travel can be expected in the event of participation at Trade shows or training. 
Sales Experience: A minimum of 3 years of outbound sales experience with a proven track record of meeting or exceeding KPIs and performance metrics. Strong understanding of the key tenants of a sales process and sales funnel. 
Book Management: Minimum of 3 years of experience managing a large book of business (B2B sales experience preferred).
B2B Expertise: Proven ability to navigate complex B2B sales cycles, conduct business needs analyses, and apply sound business judgment.
Adaptability: Comfortable operating in a fast-paced, high-growth environment with evolving priorities and goals.
Accountability: Demonstrates ownership over performance, with a proactive approach to personal development and alignment with team and business objectives.
Communication Proficiency: Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to influence and build rapport across customers and internal stakeholders.
Technical Proficiency: Comfortable using digital tools and platforms, including email, video conferencing, CRM systems (e.g., Salesforce), spreadsheets (Google Sheets/Excel), and productivity tools. Prior experience working remotely and familiarity with AI tools is a plus.
Schedule Adherence: A standard workday consists of eight hours. Employees outside the Eastern Time Zone (EST) are encouraged to align with EST hours. All BAMs must be available between 7:00 AM and 7:00 PM in their local time zone, with a majority of hours overlapping with 9:00 AM to 4:00 PM EST.
Mandatory Training: Attendance at all training sessions is mandatory and cannot accommodate absences, time off, or tardiness during the initial training period.

Compensation and Benefits:

Salary & Bonus Compensation: A performance-based compensation structure is offered, including a base salary range of $32,400 - $38,000 per year, with adjustments based on geography and cost of living. First-year BAMs typically earn between $115,000 and $125,000 annually (base salary + commission), contingent upon performance against sales goals.
Insurance: Comprehensive Health, Dental, and Vision insurance coverage options effective on the first day of employment.
Time Off Options: Immediate accrual of Paid Time Off (PTO), seven paid federal holidays, one floating holiday, and options for paid/unpaid parental leave.
401(k): 401(k) savings plan with a company match of up to 4%.
Employee Discount: Dynamic Wayfair discount for personal purchases.
Bonuses: Competitive bonus potential based on performance metrics.
Sales Incentives: SPIFFs and sales contests for additional earning opportunities.
Tuition Reimbursement: Full-Time Employees with at least six months of tenure are eligible for tuition reimbursement of up to $5,250 per year for pre-approved courses from accredited institutions.
Referral Bonus: A $500 referral bonus for each eligible referral that is hired.
Collaborative and Inclusive Environment: Participation in a collaborative work environment and team culture.

Title: Software Engineer III, Supply Chain Retail Technology
RoleDescription:
Candidates for this position are preferred to be based in Bangalore, India and will be expected to comply with their team's hybrid work schedule requirements.
Who We Are:
 
Wayfair runs the largest custom e-commerce large parcel network in the United States, approximately 1.6 million square meters of logistics space. The nature of the network is inherently a highly variable ecosystem that requires flexible, reliable, and resilient systems to operate efficiently. 
 
We are looking for a passionate Backend Software Engineer to join the Fulfillment Optimization team. This team builds the platforms that determine how customer orders are fulfilled, optimizing for Wayfair profitability and customer delight. A big part of our work revolves around enhancing and scaling customer-facing platforms that provide fulfillment information on our websites, starting at the top of the customer funnel on the search pages all the way through orders being delivered. Throughout this customer journey, we are responsible for maintaining an accurate representation of our dynamic supply chain, determining how different products will fit into boxes, predicting how these boxes will flow through warehouses and trucks, and ultimately surfacing the information our customers need to inform their decision and the details our suppliers and carriers require to successfully execute on the promises made to our customers. We do all of this in milliseconds, thousands of times per second.
 
What Youll Do:

Partner with your business stakeholders to provide them with transparency, data, and resources to make informed decisions
Be a technical leader within and across the teams you work with.
Drive high impact architectural decisions and hands-on development, including inception, design, execution, and delivery following good design and coding practices.
Obsessively focus on production readiness for the team including testing, monitoring, deployment, documentation and proactive troubleshooting.
Identify risks and gaps in technical approaches and propose solutions to meet team and project goals.
Create proposals and action plans to garner support across the organization.
Influence and contribute to the teams strategy and roadmap.
Tenacity for learning - curious, and constantly pushing the boundary of what is possible.

 
We Are a Match Because You Have:

6-9 years of experience in backend software engineering architecting and implementing robust, distributed web applications


Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or equivalent combination of education and experience


Track-record of technical leadership for teams following software development best practices (e.g. SOLID, TDD, GRASP, YAGNI, etc).
Track-record of being a hands-on developer efficiently building technically sound systems.
Experience building web services with java and springboot.
Experience with Continuous Integration (CI/CD) practices and tools (Buildkite, Jenkins, etc.).
Experience architecting solutions leveraging distributed infrastructure (e.g. Docker, Kubernetes, etc).
Experience with Microsoft SQL Server, Aerospike, Redis.
Experience leveraging monitoring and logging technologies (e.g. DataDog, Elasticsearch, InfluxDB, etc).

Title: Executive Assistant
RoleDescription:
This position is a hybrid in-office role that works out of our Boston HQ. Monday-Thursday will be working in office and Friday is WFH. This is not a virtual / remote position.
Wayfair, one of the largest retailers of home furnishings and housewares in the United States, has an immediate need for an Executive Assistant to manage the day-to-day activities for leaders across our Marketing and Specialty Retail Brand teams. This is a fantastic opportunity for the right individual to support the senior leaders of one of the fastest-growing companies in Boston. The ideal candidate will bring strong organizational and planning skills, detail orientation, a high sense of urgency, a sense of humor, and problem-solving abilities to the role. This person should be smart, engaging, fun, curious, and unflappable.
Wayfairs team of Executive Assistants play a crucial role in supporting executives. Their responsibilities include scheduling and coordinating meetings, managing travel arrangements, and opportunities to own projects across different operational functions. This position offers a unique opportunity for an experienced executive assistant looking to elevate their career.
What Youll Do:

Executive Support: Provide support for 3-6 leaders in Marketing and Specialty Retail Brands. Enhance the executives' efficiency and effectiveness through comprehensive support. 
Calendar Management: Organize and manage all aspects of internal and external meetings with the ability to schedule and prioritize meetings, resolve schedule conflicts, collaborate with other team members, and stay several steps ahead to maintain efficiency.
Travel Management: Arrange all travel details, both domestic and international, with the ability to make frequent revisions as necessary.
Expense Management: Handle monthly business expense reports, ensuring timely and accurate processing.
Event Planning: Support with planning, coordination and execution of team events.
Customer Focus: Maintain a customer-centric approach, ask pertinent questions in meetings, and readily adapt to new challenges.
Teamwork and Positivity: Foster a collaborative team environment, keep a positive attitude, and proactively support colleagues and company events.

RoleDescription:
Candidates for this position are preferred to be based in Bangalore, India and will be expected to comply with their team's hybrid work schedule requirements.

Wayfair runs the largest custom e-commerce large parcel network in the United States, approximately 1.6 million square meters of logistics space. The nature of the network is inherently a highly variable ecosystem that requires flexible, reliable, and resilient systems to operate efficiently.
The Platform Insights team is looking for smart, passionate and curious people who are excited to help us scale, support, and engineer our database, distributed analytic, and dashboards. Identify, propose, and drive initiatives to advance the technical skills, standards, practices, architecture, and documentation of our engineering teams.

Continuously rethink and push the status quo, even when it challenges your/our established ideas.

Results-oriented, collaborative, pragmatic, and continuous improvement mindset.
10+ years of experience in engineering, out of which at least 5-6 years spent in leading highly performant teams.
Experience in development of new applications using technologies such as Python, Java or Go.
Experience making architectural and design-related decisions for large scale platforms, understanding the tradeoffs between time-to-market vs. flexibility.
Significant experience and vocation in managing and enabling peoples growth and performance.

Capability to communicate and collaborate across the wider organization, influencing decisions with and without direct authority and always with inclusive, adaptable, and persuasive communication.
Analytical and decision-making skills that integrate technical and business requirements

L2 Learning Experience Designer (GSC Training)
Wayfair is currently seeking an experienced Learning Experience Design (LXD) professional to

Project management and organizational skills for multiple projects running concurrently required

Title: Sr. Analyst, Cross Channel Marketing
RoleDescription:
This position is a hybrid in-office role that works out of our Boston HQ. Monday-Thursday will be working in office and Friday is WFH. This is not a virtual / remote position.
*At this time, Wayfair does not provide sponsorship for employment authorization for this position.
The Sr. cross channel analyst is a marketing generalist who supports the CMO function for Wayfair Canada, specifically to drive performance marketing success. This person is the resident expert on marketing channel performance for the brands, steers the marketing strategic planning process (i.e., forecasting and roadmap collaboration), and leads the thinking on multi-channel marketing strategies (e.g, targeting) that improve channel effectiveness and customers health. 
What Youll Do:

Marketing Performance: Own the marketing performance narrative in all formal and informal touchpoints. Execute deep-dive investigations that span across channels (in partnership with marketing channel teams) to deliver actionable insights to department leadership. Own all formal reporting.
Channel Effectiveness: Deep understanding of full marketing funnel to serve as strategic thought partner to marketing channel teams. Hold individual channels accountable for test rigor and business results. Draw connections across channel roadmaps (e.g., between prospecting & email) to improve overall customer experience to amplify channel-specific performance. Promote a balanced focus on operational excellence.
Strategic Planning: Drive the ad spend forecasting process with the channel leads to ladder up into the broader quarterly P&L process, in partnership with Brand Finance. Intra-quarter, lead the monitoring and management of performance metrics against the forecast. 
Strategic Projects: Support investigation into cross-channel levers (e.g., personalization, targeting, retargeting) to improve customer growth / customer health. Serve as a project manager for complex multi-channel projects, ensuring scalability / sustainability of initiatives, knowledge-sharing and impactful results. 

What You Need: 

3+ years of experience in a performance marketing role.
Strong analytical skills with experience using tools such as SQL and Looker.
Experience developing roadmaps and informing marketing strategies.
Highly organized with the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously .
Strong verbal and written communication skills, with an ability to tailor updates to the appropriate audience (senior stakeholders, peers, analysts, etc.).
An entrepreneurial mindset with the ability to thrive in a highly ambiguous and fast-paced environment with a dynamic bias for action.

Title: Safety & Security Administrator - Contract
RoleDescription:
Safety & Security Administrator - Contract 
We are Wayfair; we deliver a best-in-class customer experience in the furniture and home space. We are driven, determined and relentless about taking care of our people in a fast paced environment in a rapidly growing eCommerce company. The Global Safety & Security (GLOSS) team is a multifunctional team, providing risk mitigation support to Wayfairs diverse teams.
GLOSS is responsible for protecting team members and company assets. We support OHS and environmental compliance, intelligence collection and security protection initiatives. GLOSS members collaborate with multiple business partners at all levels on process improvements while evolving our organizational culture through an inclusive approach to health, safety, environment and security. GLOSS is growing! We are currently looking for a Safety & Security Supervisor for our Fulfillment Centre in the Mississauga, Ontario area.
The Safety and Security Site Administrator will be responsible for providing leadership on all safety, and asset protection related standards, systems, processes. Well versed in regional OHS and environmental legislation, the successful candidate will support site leadership in driving our safety and security program initiatives across the site. The successful candidate will be responsible for providing site leadership with options, recommendations, and best practices as a subject matter expert in safety and security. 
What Youll Do

Partner with operations to ensure the implementation and adherence of all aspects of our Injury and Illness Prevention Plan for assigned location.
Partner with the Global Safety and Security Business Support and Compliance Teams to support operations in executing Global Safety and Security initiatives.
Escalate requested changes and best practices to the Safety Compliance Team for review and standardization.
Anticipate, identify, evaluate hazardous conditions, and build practices to aid in all critical incident planning, preparation, and responses.
Conduct inspections of facilities to identify corrective actions and risk mitigation steps for potential hazards, security risks, and regulatory compliance concerns.
Partner cross-functionally with all levels of site management in assigned location to mitigate risk and resolve safety and security related issues.
Partner with site leadership in developing action plans to improve safety/security culture in assigned location and promote employee engagement in safety/security programs.
Partner with operations and key stakeholders, to ensure all new hires receive safety orientation, and verify annual training requirements for existing employees.
Assist in the implementation and execution of safety and security accountability programs.
Maintain effective working relationships with regulatory agencies, industry security and life safety professionals, vendors, and suppliers.
Prepare and submit incident reports in compliance with company and insurance carrier requirements. Support any related investigations.
Provide daily guidance to the third-party guard service. Ensure guards are following documented post orders. Work to ensure there are no gaps in guard coverage.
Conduct physical security, camera system and access control checks to ensure compliance. 

What Youll Need

2+ years in a dedicated, progressive Safety role with tangible exposure to asset protection techniques, or similar experience required. Bachelors Degree not required but preferred.
Lean Six-Sigma experience desired.
Demonstrated knowledge of legal and regulatory requirements that govern worker health and safety, physical assessment and ergonomic skills, and case management skills.
Knowledge of municipal, provincial, and federal occupational health, safety and environmental regulations and laws.
Demonstrated working knowledge of safety and security concepts, best practices, policies, programs, and procedures. Preferably in a distribution environment.
Working knowledge of conveyor safety, fork truck safety, hand tool safety and ergonomics.
Working knowledge of workers compensation case management.
Ability to handle multiple projects, set priorities, strong organizational and time management skills.
Flexibility to support multiple buildings across multiple shifts that are dynamic and have changing business needs.
Excellent analytical and organizational skills, with demonstrated experience in hypothesis-driven learning, turning data into actionable insights.
Superior communication skills with the ability to navigate a complex organization and generate buy-in for ideas and plans.
Entrepreneurial mindset, with a bias for action and ability to deal with extreme ambiguity and rapidly changing environments.
Strong reputation for honesty, integrity, and professionalism, including an ability to maintain confide
Must be able to stand and or walk in a variety of weather and terrain conditions for shifts up to 10 hours.
Must be able to lift and hold 15 pounds.
Be able to work effectively in a warehouse environment with hot and cold conditions, equipment traffic, and possible loud noises. 
Ability to travel within your assigned area of responsibility. Occasional (10%) overnight travel is required.

Perigold, the destination for luxury home, is opening its first physical retail stores, first-of-their-kind luxury retail destinations of 20-30K square feet, with the best products in all styles and from across our catalog including furniture, decor, housewares, and home improvement categories. Title: Part Time Engineer, IT Onboarding and Asset Management
RoleDescription:
This is a part-time position requiring 20 to 30 hours of work per week.
 
Who We Are [IT Onboarding and Asset Management]
The Employee Tech IT Onboarding and IT Asset Management team, part of IT Shared Services, is responsible for ensuring all global new hires and internal employee transfers have all the technology they need when they start their new role with Wayfair as well as ensuring governance of the hardware management in Europe. Activities include administration of the IT asset inventory within the ServiceNow platform, collaborating with external processes and teams to include IT Procurement, IT Finance, Vendor Management in the collection of critical attributes supporting the effective and timely management of IT assets through their lifecycle.  This includes, but is not limited to; hardware sourcing and deployment, new hire onboarding and support, process efficiency implementations, and internal audit reporting.
We are looking for a high-energy, critical-thinking team member, who is dedicated to helping their manager drive growth, productivity, and results, while upholding the main goal of delivering great service to Wayfairians. This role is for someone who is comfortable working part time and helping Wayfair deliver results in the Onboarding and Assets space.
 
What Youll Do

Manage onboarding inventory and stock of necessary computer hardware and peripheral accessories.
Improve the lifecycle of IT assets, including inventory, assignment, stockroom, harvesting, and disposal.
Utilize the ServiceNow Hardware/IT Asset Management product to execute or support regular audits of physical assets.
Create and publish monthly status inventories and usage positions, including global IT assets.
Drive continuous process improvements and partner with asset owners to ensure accurate and up-to-date asset information throughout the hardware lifecycle.
Maintain required component and emergency spare inventory levels at Berlin, DE, London, GBR, and Galway, IRE.
Support and lead orientation sessions to get new hires operational on their Day 1.
Ensure all New Hire Information is entered correctly and fulfilled, coordinating with the Global shipping vendor for fulfillment once fully implemented.
Work with 3rd party contractor agencies and Wayfair Talent Acquisition on new hire issues.
Work with internal stakeholders to meet hiring forecasts and coordinate on new hire onboarding.
Help the team meet or surpass established KPI goals (SLA, end-user survey, hardware metrics, NPS, etc.) for task completion.


Communicate effectively with end-users and co-workers across multiple platforms and mediums (email, instant messaging, phone, ticket updates, and in-person).
Utilize critical problem-solving skills to prioritize work and pivot on daily tasks.
Implement creative solutions to deliver better service.
Build relationships with 3rd party vendors to support computer hardware sourcing.

 
What Youll Need

ITIL knowledge
Experience with ServiceNow or similar ticketing systems.
Experience with CMDB, JAMF, and Intune. 
Experience with the full IT asset lifecycle.
